cards.title: Dimension constraints implemented
cards.description: Max 8m x 4m in either orientation. Validation working.

cards.title: Pent roof positioning for attachments
cards.description: Fixed rotation and positioning for all 4 attachment directions (left, right, front, back).

cards.title: Roof height constraints
cards.description: Apex: eaves 800-2400mm, crest 1000-4500mm. Pent: both walls 1000-2400mm. Crest must exceed eaves. Hipped: same as apex (geometry TODO).

cards.title: Door/window size validation
cards.description: Openings can't overlap (50mm min gap), can't exceed wall boundaries (100mm from edges). Smart placement finds free spots. Blocks adding when no space left.

cards.title: Marketing landing page
cards.description: Create a landing page to showcase the configurator.

cards.title: README documentation
cards.description: Write comprehensive README for the GitHub repo.

cards.title: MIT License added
cards.description: Added MIT license to the Parametric-shed2 repo.

cards.title: Decision Map page
cards.description: Interactive flowchart for mapping strategic decisions. Added to project board app.

cards.title: Potting Shed preset
cards.description: Created and saved potting shed preset (2m √ó 3.6m) with three windows and pent roof.

cards.title: Parametric shelving system
cards.description: Add shelving as a new element type (like doors/windows). Parameters: wall, inside/outside, height, starting position, length. Include in BOM.

cards.title: Browser access for James
cards.description: Set up browser access so James can see and interact with the configurator. Options: (1) Clawdbot browser tool with Chrome extension relay, (2) Puppeteer/Playwright automation, (3) VNC/remote desktop. Would enable: screenshots for README, direct visual testing, debugging UI issues like purlin positioning.

cards.title: Monetization decision mapping
cards.description: Map monetization paths in Decision Map with full arguments and evaluation. Options: Enhanced direct sales, DIY plans, Licensing, Niche builds, Spectrum model.

cards.title: üîÑ Competitor Intelligence (ongoing)
cards.description:
Continuous market awareness and competitor monitoring. This is a parent project ‚Äî never 'done'. See linked deliverables below.

**Completed deliverables:**
‚Ä¢ Initial landscape analysis (card #31)
‚Ä¢ Tech gap analysis (card #32)
‚Ä¢ Quick Garden profile (card #33)

**Files:**
‚Ä¢ /competitor-analysis.md (main report)
‚Ä¢ /shed-project-board/competitors.md (profiles)

**Backlog:**
‚Ä¢ Deep-dive: Crane Garden Buildings
‚Ä¢ Deep-dive: Scotts of Thrapston
‚Ä¢ Keyword/SEO competitor research
‚Ä¢ Pricing intelligence
‚Ä¢ Quarterly refresh

cards.title: Add screenshot to README
cards.description: Grab a nice screenshot or GIF of the configurator for the README hero image.

cards.title: SEO improvements
cards.description:
Improve SEO on bespokeshedcompany.co.uk. Full analysis: /home/ser/clawd/memory/seo-analysis-bespokeshedcompany.md

**Critical issues:**
‚Ä¢ Thin content (~100 words per product page, need 500+)
‚Ä¢ Poor page titles (numbered, generic)
‚Ä¢ No blog content since 2019
‚Ä¢ Weak location targeting (one mention of Wiltshire)
‚Ä¢ Zero reviews showing
‚Ä¢ Configurator not mentioned anywhere

**Quick wins:**
1. Fix page titles (remove numbers, add keywords + location)
2. Write 500+ words per product page
3. Get 5 Google reviews
4. Add 'Design Your Own' page linking to configurator

**Medium term:**
‚Ä¢ Location landing pages (/garden-buildings-salisbury/ etc)
‚Ä¢ Blog with case studies
‚Ä¢ FAQ schema markup

cards.title: Website rebuild strategy
cards.description: Decide on approach: refresh current, full rebuild, add e-commerce/quote system, or hybrid configurator model. See Decision Map.

cards.title: Mobile UX for configurator
cards.description: Bottom drawer panel, 55vh height, larger fonts (14-16px), touch-friendly controls, auto-collapse on load, tap-to-close, modern IKEA-inspired theme.

cards.title: Monetization strategy document
cards.description: Create comprehensive monetization strategy doc in the repo. Cover: direct sales, DIY plans, licensing, niche builds, spectrum model, supplier partnerships.

cards.title: Fastest-to-revenue roadmap
cards.description: Prioritize monetization paths by speed-to-revenue. Create actionable roadmap: Week 1, Month 1, Quarter 1 milestones.

cards.title: Embed configurator on bespokeshedcompany.co.uk
cards.description: Deploy parametric configurator on the business website. First monetization step: capture leads, enable quotes.

cards.title: Hipped roof implementation
cards.description: Add hipped roof style option. Currently placeholder in roof style dropdown. Requires new geometry: hip rafters from corners to ridge, jack rafters on all four sides.

cards.title: Fix apex roof on attached buildings
cards.description: Apex roof on attached buildings not working properly. Needs investigation and fix.

cards.title: Wall insulation + plywood lining
cards.description: 50mm PIR insulation between studs, 12mm plywood lining inside. Skips door/window openings. Tied to insulated variant. Added to BOM.

cards.title: Cripple studs below windows
cards.description: Added missing cripple studs from bottom plate to window sill. Works for all wall orientations.

cards.title: Divider height modes
cards.description: Added heightMode: 'walls' (to eaves) or 'roof' (fill to crest). Z-axis dividers get triangular gable frames, X-axis get flat fill.

cards.title: CSG boolean cuts for plywood around openings
cards.description: Plywood panels now use CSG subtraction to cut around doors/windows instead of skipping walls with openings.

cards.title: Fix apex purlins - horizontal positioning
cards.description: Purlins should be HORIZONTAL (not tilted with slope) and SIT ON TOP of rafters. Currently broken - parenting to roofRoot causes unexpected tilt. Needs investigation into transform hierarchy.

cards.title: Code documentation + JSDoc comments
cards.description: Add proper JSDoc comments to roof.js, walls.js, attachments.js. Clean up dead code, improve console logging. PROGRESS: roof.js done (126 lines added), walls.js partial (45 lines), attachments.js partial (64 lines).

cards.title: Hard Rules page
cards.description: Added Rules page to project board with full CRUD. View, add, edit, delete rules. Pre-loaded with working guidelines. Data in data/rules.json.

cards.title: 2D Brain view
cards.description: Added 2D force-directed graph view as alternative to 3D brain. Uses D3.js. Pan/zoom, click nodes for details, drag to rearrange. Shared data file (data/brain.json) keeps 2D and 3D in sync.

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Landscape analysis
cards.description:
Initial UK market landscape. Three-tier breakdown: Budget (BillyOh, Tiger), Premium Prefab (Quick Garden, Crane, Scotts), True Bespoke. Market positioning identified.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)
**File:** /competitor-analysis.md

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Tech gap analysis
cards.description:
Comparison table: 3D visualisation, parametric model, real-time pricing, cutting lists. Key finding: NO UK competitor has true parametric 3D with cutting list output. Major differentiator.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)
**File:** /competitor-analysis.md

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Quick Garden profile
cards.description:
Deep-dive on Quick Garden. European manufacturer, 26k+ customers, log cabin specialists. No online configurator ‚Äî manual bespoke process. Lead times 4-10 weeks. Pricing examples gathered.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)
**File:** /shed-project-board/competitors.md

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Crane deep-dive
cards.description:
Full profile of Crane Garden Buildings. Norfolk workshop, 50+ years, 13 UK showrooms, National Trust partnership. Has 'configurator' but likely just options selector. HIGH threat ‚Äî similar premium positioning.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Scotts deep-dive
cards.description:
Full profile of Scotts of Thrapston. 100+ years, hardwood specialists, equestrian/garages. Very traditional consultative model. Different customer journey but worth understanding.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)

cards.title: üìä Competitor: SEO/keyword research
cards.description:
Research what keywords competitors rank for. Identify gaps and opportunities. Tools: Ubersuggest, SEMrush free tier, or manual Google research.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)

cards.title: üìä Competitor: Pricing intelligence
cards.description:
Gather real pricing data across competitors. Build comparison matrix. Understand where Andrew sits in the market and identify pricing strategy opportunities.

**Parent:** Competitor Intelligence (#13)
